block_comment: This block of code implements a configurable shift register functionality in Verilog. Upon each positive edge of the clock ('ck'), the block checks for the enable signal ('en').  If 'en' is high, it latches the 16th bit of the 'shift' register into 'sd'. The subsequent actions depend on the 'frame' value. If 'frame' equals 0, the block loads 'shift' with the value of 'left' signal. If 'frame' equals the mid-point, the block loads 'shift' with the value of 'right' signal. Otherwise, the block performs a left shift on 'shift' itself.
